dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, today we're diving into something that really flips conventional wisdom on its head, especially when it comes to, like, negotiation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, today we're diving into something that really flips conventional wisdom on its head, especially when it comes to, like, negotiation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I'm ready. My negotiation skills could always use a boost, you know? All those books about win-win and preparation...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I'm ready. My negotiation skills could always use a boost, you know? All those books about win-win and preparation...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Well, forget all that! This article we read, it's called "Deconstructing Goals and Objectives (and Why It's Irrelevant)."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, forget all that! This article we read, it's called Deconstructing Goals and Objectives and Why It's Irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not have a title. Its first section is titled "Identifying your goals and objectives".

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Irrelevant? But, like, don't you need goals to know what you're even negotiating for?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Irrelevant? But, like, don't you need goals to know what you're even negotiating for?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: You would think, right? But the article argues that identifying them is, um, a surprisingly difficult hurdle, and that experts who say it's 50% of success are actually wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You would think, right? But the article argues that identifying them is, um, a surprisingly difficult hurdle, and that experts who say it's fifty percent of success are actually wrong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Identifying your goals and objectives Effectively identifying your goals and objectives is seemingly a simple step but many experts suggest it accounts for 50% of your success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so if not direct goals, then what *do* you focus on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so if not direct goals, then what do you focus on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: It says, ignore direct gains, profits, benefits. Those are, uh, largely irrelevant. Instead, focus exclusively on environmental factors and the expectations of people around you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says, ignore direct gains, profits, benefits. Those are, uh, largely irrelevant. Instead, focus exclusively on environmental factors and the expectations of people around you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The important part of this step setting goals and objectives has to take into consideration not only direct gains, profits and benefits. These are imperative, but equally vital are your business and life environment as well as the cultural perceptions and expectations of the people around you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so, like, the vibe? Not the numbers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so, like, the vibe? Not the numbers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then, when you look at your goals, assess them by asking: is this a one-time engagement, or a long collaboration that will, um, *lose value over time*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then, when you look at your goals, assess them by asking: is this a one-time engagement, or a long collaboration that will, um, lose value over time?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Is this a one-time engagement or the beginning of the long road of a collaboration process, which will grow in value over time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Lose value? That's... that's not how I usually think about long-term collaborations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lose value? That's... that's not how I usually think about long-term collaborations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it gets wilder! Next up: information is noise. Seriously, it's the enemy of your success. Don't prepare by collecting data or using classic MBA formulas like 5W1H.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it gets wilder! Next up: information is noise. Seriously, it's the enemy of your success. Don't prepare by collecting data or using classic M B A formulas like five W one hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Information is power! Small or big negotiations, it doesnt matter information is the fuel of your success in moving towards your goals and objectives. Thus, it is important to prepare well by collecting and analyzing information using a classic MBA formula for business background research and problem solving: 5W or 5W1H (who, what, when, where, why and how).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, no 5W1H? No LinkedIn research on your counterpart? Thatâ€™s like, basic prep!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, no five W one hours? No LinkedIn research on your counterpart? That's like, basic prep!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope! The article says modern ICTs are poor tools for information gathering. Avoid *all* information if you're trying to negotiate a deal. And SWOTs? Forget about them too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope! The article says modern I C T s are poor tools for information gathering. Avoid all information if you're trying to negotiate a deal. And S W O T s? Forget about them too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Modern Information and Communication Technologies (ICTs) provide great tools for information gathering including general business data in databanks and information about counterparts on LinkedIn, Facebook, etc.). Prepare SWOTs SWOT analysis is a simple yet very powerful tool in preparation for the negotiation process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles incredulously] SWOTs? I mean, everyone learns SWOT analysis. Strengths, Weaknesses...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: S W O T s? I mean, everyone learns S W O T analysis. Strengths, Weaknesses...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: ...useless, especially for low-stakes deals. And get this: it even discourages developing an acceptable walk-away alternative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...useless, especially for low-stakes deals. And get this: it even discourages developing an acceptable walk-away alternative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SWOT analysis is a simple yet very powerful tool in preparation for the negotiation process. It might range from a few minutes of work on a piece of paper for a simple case to a full-scale complex computer-supported assessment for high stake deals. ... Experts even suggest developing an acceptable walk-away alternative in order not to get so desperate that you sign an abysmal deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: No walk-away plan? So you just, like, get desperate and sign an abysmal deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No walk-away plan? So you just, like, get desperate and sign an abysmal deal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, yes, to ensure you get *so* desperate you sign something. And also, ignore pre-meeting questions, options, plans, and the agenda itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, yes, to ensure you get so desperate you sign something. And also, ignore pre-meeting questions, options, plans, and the agenda itself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One step is to quickly run through a set of pre-meeting questions (at least 10) and possible options... Settle the agenda, sequence of negotiation steps and final achievable goals Actual negotiations may start in a hundred different ways... However, all textbook examples of successful negotiations suggest that it is crucial to set up a clear and mutually agreed agenda right at the beginning...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: The *agenda*? What are you even doing in the meeting at that point?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The agenda? What are you even doing in the meeting at that point?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: This is the kicker: it suggests disengaging from the process with apathy and disrespect. The psychological dimension of meetings? Small impact. Forget cool-headed professionalism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: This is the kicker: it suggests disengaging from the process with apathy and disrespect. The psychological dimension of meetings? Small impact. Forget cool-headed professionalism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The psychological dimension of negotiation meetings makes a surprisingly big impact on the negotiation process and outcomes... Therefore, successful negotiation includes showing your cool-headed professionalism, developing well-structured communication procedures and engaging in the bargaining process with full confidence as well as full respect for the person or a team across the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, walk in unprepared, uninformed, with no goals, no backup plan, and be a jerk? [laughs]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, walk in unprepared, uninformed, with no goals, no backup plan, and be a jerk?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And don't even bother establishing your own style or keeping notes on past successes. It's, uh, all irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And don't even bother establishing your own style or keeping notes on past successes. It's, uh, all irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: it is important to establish your own style and approach to the negotiation process by creating your personal archive with a set of notes or databank about every successful negotiation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's... a take. I don't know if I'd recommend it to our listeners, but it's certainly a different way to look at things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's... a take. I don't know if I'd recommend it to our listeners, but it's certainly a different way to look at things.
